Package com.github.dakusui.fruitjuice

"Fruit-juice" is a simple dependency injection library, like Guice.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Context
    An interface that represents an object context.
    Context.Builder
    A builder of a Context object.
    InjectionPoint
    An interface that represents a point at which a dependency injection by the FruitJuice framework happens.
    InjectionPoint.ConstructorParameter
    An interface that models a parameter of a constructor.
    InjectionPoint.TargetElement
    An interface that represents an element an InjectionPoint targets.
    InjectionRequest
    An interface that represents a request that defines what object should be injected to an injection point to which this object belongs.
    Injector
    The injector of the FruitJuice framework.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Context.Builder.Base
    A generic base class of Context.Builder.
    InjectionRequest.Base
    A base class of a InjectionRequest.
    Injector.Impl
    A simple implementation of Injector interface.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    FruitJuice
    The entry point to the FruitJuice framework.
    InjectionPoint.Factory
    A factory class that creates InjectionPoint objects.
    InjectionPoint.Type
    Injection point type.
    InjectionRequest.Factory
    A factory class to create InjectionRequest objects.
    Injector.Utils
    A utility class for Injector mechanism.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Inject
    An annotation to let Fruit-juice know elements annotated with this can be used for dependency injection.

Package com.github.dakusui.fruitjuice Description

"Fruit-juice" is a simple dependency injection library, like Guice.

Guice is a sophisticated and very feature rich library for broader purposes but at the same time difficult to use some times.

In Guice, values to be injected are provided based on conditions satisfied by "injection points" And those conditions are composed from type, generic type parameters, type of annotations given to the target elements. If multiple points satisfy the same set of conditions, the same provider (or instance) will be injected to all those points. And the condition (usually) cannot contain attributes of an annotation. Therefore, it is hard to wire objects in following code snippet by Guice. 

    @Inject
    @Add({1,2,3})
    private int sum;  // I want to inject 6 (=1+2+3) to this field by Guice.
In order to achieve this, you can use a mechanism called "CustomInjections", but it seemed to me a bit more complicated than it can be. Fruit-juice is a library specialized in this sort of use cases. Following is a diagram that illustrates what happens behind the scene of the framework. 
 +----+                                                       +---------------+
 |User|                                                       | Class<Target>|
 +----+                                                       +---------------+
    |new        +---------------+                                     |
    |---------->|Context.Builder|                                     |
    |           +---------------+                                     |
    |                   |                                             |
    |FruitJuice.createInjector(Context.Builder +--------+             |
    |----------------------------------------->|Injector|             |
    |                   |                      +--------+             |
    |getInstance(Class<Target>)                     |                 |
    |---------------------------------------------->|                 |
    |                   |                           |collect injection points and
    |                   |                           |determine constructor
    |                   |                           |---------------->||
    |                   |                           |                 ||
    |                   |add(InjectionPoint)        |                 |
    |                   ||<-------------------------||                |
    |                   ||                          ||                |
    :                   :                           :                 :
    |                   |                           ||                |
    |                   |build()                    ||                |
    |                   ||<-------------------------||                |
    |                   ||                          ||                |
    |                   ||      +-------+           ||                |
    |                   ||----->|Context|           ||                |
    |                   ||      +-------+           ||                |
    |                   ||          |               ||                |
    |                   |           |lookup(InjectionRequest)         |
    |                   |           ||<-------------||                |
    |                   |           ||              ||                |
    :                   :           :               :                 :
    |                   |           |               ||                |
    |                   |           |               |invoke constructor with injected parameter values
    |                   |           |               ||--------------->||
    |                   |           |               ||                ||new       +------+
    |                   |           |               ||                ||--------->|Target|
    |                   |           |               ||                ||          +------+
    |                   |           |               ||                |               |
    |                   |           |               ||                |inject field values
    |                   |           |               ||                ||------------->||
    :                   :           :               :                 :               :
    |                   |           |               ||                |               |
    |                   |           |               ||
    |< - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -||
    |                   |           |               |
    |                   |           |               |
Names and semantics of classes included in Fruit-juice library are meant to be similar to ones in Guice. A major difference between them is to give Context.Builder object to FruitJuice.createInjector(...) method, instead of Modules. Injector adds injection points, which have accesses to annotations given to themselves, to the builder on injection operation. Once all the injection points are added to the builder, it will then calls build() method, which creates an actual Context. From this Context object, the Injector looks up an appropriate object to be injected by InjectionRequest, which is held by InjectionPoint, for each point. To help a task to implement the above mentioned Context.Builder, an abstract class Context.Builder.Base is provided.
See Also:
FruitJuice, Context, Context.Builder, Context.Builder.Base, Injector, InjectionPoint, InjectionRequest, Custom injections of Guice
